question: What is the risk of developing acute myelogenous leukemia in Fanconi anemia?
ideal_answer: A review of all of the cases of Fanconi anemia (FA) reported to the International Fanconi Anemia Registry (IFAR) indicates that at least 15% manifest acute myelogenous leukemia (AML) or preleukemia.

snippets.text: Sixteen of the 59 FA-C patients (27%) have developed acute myelogenous leukemia
Actuarial risk of MDS or AML was 52% (37% to 67%) by 40 years of age
A review of all of the cases of Fanconi anemia (FA) reported to the International Fanconi Anemia Registry (IFAR) indicates that at least 15% manifest acute myelogenous leukemia (AML) or preleukemia
A review of all of the cases of Fanconi anemia (FA) reported to the International Fanconi Anemia Registry (IFAR) indicates that at least 15% manifest acute myelogenous leukemia (AML) or preleukemia.

exact_answer: At least 15%, based on the International Fanconi Anemia Registry (IFAR)
